thread.title: Sorry Marty and Doc: 'Back to the Future' Cubs prediction won't come true
thread.title_full: Sorry Marty and Doc: 'Back to the Future' Cubs prediction won't come true | syracuse.com

author: Brent Axe | baxe@syracuse.com
title: Sorry Marty and Doc: 'Back to the Future' Cubs prediction won't come true
text:
When it came to predicting the future when it was released in 1989, "Back to the Future Part II" got some right and some wrong .
Video conferencing and fingerprint scanners? Nailed it.
Power laces and hoverboards? Sort of .
Abolishing all lawyers and flying cars? Unfortunately not.
But it was the prediction in the movie that the Chicago Cubs would end over 100 years of futility and finally win their first World Series since 1908 that had baseball fans excited.
The New York Mets crushed that dream Wednesday night when they eliminated the Cubs from the 2015 National League Championship Series.
Great Scott!
At a special screening for the film Wednesday, star Michael J. Fox admitted on the red carpet that he was a little torn over that one.
"It's tough because I'm a New Yorker and I would love to see the Mets do well. But I'd love the see the film be right. So I'm torn," Fox said before the game ended, adding "Whatever happens, happens."
Christopher Lloyd, who played Emmett "Doc" Brown, said he didn't really follow the predictions, except for that one.
"I'm hoping the Cubs win tonight and go into the series, that would be the ultimate prediction," Lloyd said with a bit of trepidation.
But that was not to be.
Not all is lost, Cubs fans. You can still buy the edition of USA Today printed from the movie that has the Cubs winning the series over Miami in a sweep.
Actual cover of October 23 USA Today. Well done. pic.twitter.com/CIsEorImZT
